Today, Dan and Jordan take a little break from talking about Alex Jones to dip their toes into the murky waters of Stefan Molyneux, specifically a mini-documentary he released in December 2018 about going to Poland. Documentary might be the wrong word.

==Tidbits==

*Stefan claims to be a philosopher, doesn't have a degree in philosophy
*Stefan is a high school level debater
*Stefan and his brother founded Caribou systems in 1995, sold in 2000, got about $800,000, took 18 months off, wrote a book called Revolutions (currently on Amazon for $1099)
*Stefan self publishes
*Stefan runs Free Domain Radio
*Stefan made a documentary called 100 Year March: A Philosopher in Poland
*Stefan can't see why people say Poland is far right
*"Fascism with a human face"
*Stefan holds a forum at the Freedom Lounge
*Freedom Lounge is founded by WEI
*Warsaw Enterprise Institute is rightwing propaganda thinktank
*Stefan is amazed that fascists don't call him names
*Stefan interviews Lucas Warchecka (spelling?)
*WEI keeps popping up in relation to documentary, but Stefan doesn't address this
*Krzysztof Bosak (Polish politician) "Orgniser" of 100 Year March, part of National Movement Party
*Discussion: Polish Parliament
*Discussion: 100 Year March
*Stefan misses being able to have national pride
*Stefan mistakes racism for collectivism
*Jordan renames Stefan to Turd Polisher Steve
*Stefan laments not having a tribe
*Stefan feels close to the documentary crew, but the credits don't list a crew
*Stefan has made himself singular, blames the globalists
*Is it unfair to call Stefan a white nationalist? NO
*Stefan is an empiricist who misses how what he's shown is curated
*Freedom is a fire
*Stefan ends with an ad pivot
*Discussion: The Nationalist Ecosystem
*Andy Edels
